description: From Latin mūnitiō (“a defence, fortification”) via French munition.

entries.meaning: (chiefly in the plural) Materials of war: armaments, weapons and ammunition.
(chiefly in the plural, military, NATO) Bombs, rockets, missiles (complete explosive devices, in contrast to e.g. guns).

examples: I wil stand vpon my watch, and fixe my steppe vpon the munition: and I wil behold, to see what may be sayd to me, and what I may answer to him that rebuketh me.

verbs.description: munition (third-person singular simple present munitions, present participle munitioning, simple past and past participle munitioned)
